title: Ticket #3313: missing semanage requires in condor.spec
description:
Patch submitted via github -

pull request: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/pull/2

patch: https://github.com/lwandrebeck/htcondor/commit/e5654424ae5e6a3b3c5f61be08929ca37f2d4d53

Need -

  1. condor-wiki account for Laurent [DONE]
  2. signed CLA from Laurent
  3. review & feedback on patch from packaging team [DONE]

Note - commit needs to be done with --author="Laurent Wandrebeck <l.wandrebeck@gmail.com>"
remarks:
2012-Nov-09 10:50:48 by matyas:
Reviewed the patch. Patch adds an explicit requirement for /usr/sbin/semanage for the pre-install step. However, /usr/sbin/semanage is used in the post-install step.

The issue is valid, however. I've attached a patch for how I would do it instead.

Some justification for removing the test for the existence of /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled in the post step: we cannot make a requirement conditional -- that is, we cannot say "require semanage only if selinuxenabled is also present." If we are going to bring semanage in, then we should also bring in selinuxenabled -- which makes the test superfluous.

2012-Nov-10 14:46:05 by l.wandrebeck:
Perfectly right matyas, your patch is 1st not buggy (contrary to mine) and 2nd just better. don't even bother with authorship, commit yours. Thanks for quickly taking care of that one :)

2012-Nov-14 18:15:00 by matyas:
This is now in the 7.9.2 branch. Should make sure it does not break anything and then discuss if we should merge it into 7.8.

Build 78994 ( http://submit-2.batlab.org/nmi/results/details?runID=78944 ) contains 7.8.6 RPMs built with the patch. Let me know if that works.
